revised_title: Development of the Skull in Lepidosteus Osseus
tldr: The author examines the development of the skull in Lepidosteus osseus, a type of fish, using a series of embryos and young specimens. They describe the various bones and structures that make up the skull, including the rostrum, parietals, squamosals, frontals, ethmo-nasals, nasals, prenasal bone, premaxillaries, vomers, maxillary chain, pterygoid, meso-pterygoid, preopercular, and more. This research provides valuable insights into the anatomy and evolution of fish skulls.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Vertebrate Development
